meanings.definition: Seeking to emulate or imitate someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She had an emulous spirit, always trying to copy her older sister.
meanings.sent2: The students in the art class were emulous of the talented painter.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's emulous attempt to mimic the older dog's tricks was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her emulous drive to succeed propelled her to work harder than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The emulous race between the two friends to finish their homework first was intense.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a desire to equal or surpass others.
meanings.sent1: The emulous athlete trained tirelessly to beat his own record.
meanings.sent2: In the emulous world of business, competition is fierce.
meanings.sent3: The emulous siblings constantly tried to outdo each other in everything.
meanings.sent4: Her emulous determination to win the competition was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The emulous rivalry between the two teams made for an exciting match.

meanings.definition: Showing a competitive or envious attitude.
meanings.sent1: His emulous behavior at the game showed his strong desire to win.
meanings.sent2: The emulous coworkers were always trying to outshine each other.
meanings.sent3: The emulous glances exchanged between the two singers revealed their rivalry.
meanings.sent4: Her emulous nature made her strive for excellence in everything she did.
meanings.sent5: The emulous atmosphere at the competition fueled everyone's determination to succeed.
